title: Samurai Jack

awardsHtml:
20 wins & 13 nominations

Primetime Emmy Awards

2017 Winner Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Individual Achievement in Animation
Scott Wills (production designer) (For episode "XCIII")
2017 Winner Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Individual Achievement in Animation
Bryan Andrews (storyboard artist) (For episode "XCIII")
2017 Winner Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Individual Achievement in Animation
Lou Romano (background designer) (For episode "XCV")
2017 Winner Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Individual Achievement in Animation
Craig Kellman (character designer) (For episode: "XCII".)
2005 Winner Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Individual Achievement in Animation
Bryan Andrews (storyboard artist) (For episode "The Four Seasons of Death".)

Annie Awards

2018 Winner Annie
Outstanding Achievement for Character Design in an Animated Television/Broadcast Production
Craig Kellman (Character: Various in episode: "Episode XCVI (2017)")
2018 Winner Annie
Outstanding Achievement for Production Design in an Animated Television/Broadcast Production
Scott Wills (Episode: "Episode XCIII (2017)")
2018 Winner Annie
Outstanding Achievement for Editorial in an Animated Television/Broadcast Production
Paul Douglas (Episode: "Episode XCIII (2017)", "Episode XCIV (2017)", and "Episode XCIX (2017)")
2018 Nominee Annie
Best General Audience Animated Television/Broadcast Production
(Episode: "Episode XCIII (2017)")
2005 Nominee Annie
Directing in an Animated Television Production
Genndy Tartakovsky (For episode "Tale of X-49".)

Behind the Voice Actors Awards

2018 Winner BTVA Television Voice Acting Award
Best Vocal Ensemble in a Television Series
Phil LaMarr - Tara Strong - Greg Baldwin - Tom Kenny - Grey Griffin - John DiMaggio - Sab Shimono - Aaron LaPlante - Lauren Tom - Keone Young
2018 Winner BTVA Television Voice Acting Award
Best Male Lead Vocal Performance in a Television Series
Phil LaMarr (As the voice of "Samurai Jack".)
2018 Nominee BTVA Television Voice Acting Award
Best Female Lead Vocal Performance in a Television Series
Tara Strong (As the voice of "Ashi".)
2018 Nominee BTVA Television Voice Acting Award
Best Male Vocal Performance in a Television Series in a Supporting Role
Tom Kenny (As the voice of "Scaramouch".)
